title: Infosys, Persistent slump up to 8%; buy the dip or brace for more AI-led selloff?
description: Indian IT stocks experienced a sharp decline on Tuesday. This selloff is driven by concerns over artificial intelligence disrupting the sector. Analysts are divided on whether to invest now or wait. Some believe the market is overreacting and valuations are becoming attractive.
content:

title: European shares slip as trade uncertainty, AI-disruption fears weigh
description: European shares slipped on Tuesday as investors avoided large bets against an uncertain trade backdrop, while banks tanked, tracking a Wall Street selloff after artificial intelligence-disruption concerns resurfaced.
content:
Feb 24 (Reuters) - European shares slipped on Tuesday as investors avoided large bets against an uncertain trade backdrop, while banks tanked, tracking a Wall Street selloff after artificial intelligence-disruption concerns resurfaced.

title: World shares are mixed after heavy selling of potential AI losers hits Wall Street
description: Shares are mixed in Europe and Asia after U.S. stocks slumped on heavy selling of shares in companies that could be losers in the artificial-intelligence boom
content:
BANGKOK (AP) — World shares were mixed Tuesday after U.S. stocks slumped on heavy selling of shares in companies that could be losers in the artificial-intelligence boom.

title: AI’s impact on human employment will vary in line with what tasks are open to automation
description: Technology rarely wipes out entire professions. So too with the rise of AI in offices. Jobs differ from tasks and we can expect artificial intelligence to take over the tasks that are routine, codifiable and easy to automate. This need not reduce jobs as much as rejig them.
content: Venture capitalist Vinod Khosla set the cat among the pigeons by saying that AI may destroy the software services and business processing outsourcing businesses that are so important to the Indian economy. Elsewhere, shares of major software service ... [4882 chars]

title: IIT Madras’ professor B Ravindran joins United Nations AI Scientific Panel
description: Professor B Ravindran from IIT Madras has joined the United Nations Independent International Scientific Panel on Artificial Intelligence. This global panel comprises 40 leading experts. They will assess AI's impact on lives and societies worldwide. Professor Ravindran expressed honor in representing India and the Global South.

content:

title: IIT-M professor appointed to UN's Independent International Scientific Panel on AI
description: Chennai, Feb 24 (PTI) Professor B Ravindran of the IIT, Madras here has been appointed to the United Nations Independent International Scientific Panel on Artificial Intelligence, the city-based premier research institution said on Tuesday. title: IT stocks may have priced in too much AI risk: Kotak Institutional Equities
